comment.body: Wow, that is interesting! Good luck with further improvments.
Technically it can work on mobile though gateways. It could work for the first times.

Awesome! This site gets better and better every day. It would be cooler though if when I choose 'most voted' mode votes were visible without needing to point the cursor to quotes. The same goes to creation data in 'ordered by date' mode.

> [ekaterina](#comment_6_1Mk5sVKeCrwMc3wSD11jM7DZTiqF5D9BaD): That's a great idea! By creation data, do you mean the date the quote was created? And thanks for the kind words :)

I mean the date when the quote was published on ZeroQuote. Your way is also plausible, but users will need additional field to fill then.
By the way it would be nice if there is ability to choose/filter quotes by language. It also needs additional field to fill though.
There is only one quote in russian from me, so it is easy to spot it).
Amazing work! Is it possible to use the same tasks list on PC and mobile?

Yep, If this site could have some additional useful features like Task Coach or Todo.txt do and ZeroNet become available on mobile it could be real and pretty attractive alternative for mentioned apps.
Really cool site. Just created my own poll there).

Yes, it looks amazing now!

About throwaway ZeroIDs... I think the very idea of polls may become useless with the sybil attack issue. Maybe we need something like [Proof of individuality](http://www.i-m.mx/unicorn23/POI/proofofindividuality) here.
In order to prevent spam with multiple IDs some cryptocurrencies could be used. The same way as it is done with ZeroName for domains registration.

That is amazing! IMHO, next best feature to add would be an ability of modifying the poll by its author: rephrasing, deleting or adding new options to it. After a poll was edited users which have already voted on it see a notification with suggestion to change their vote.

It is really often situation when you add new poll and then suddenly realize that you forgot to add some options to it.
